node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mary Montero ✏️ TWAMV on August 23, 2021. May be an image of indoor.

node.text: I looooove having the task cards that I use on a daily basis in such a handy place! The top row includes all of my reading response task cards, and the bottom two rows are my new mental math task cards! I've always done mental math with my students, but I decided it would be MUCH easier to have them ready to go and scaffolded to use all year! Link in profile to read more about them! https://bit.ly/MentalMathTaskCards

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mary Montero ✏️ TWAMV on August 22, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, child and indoor.

node.text: Big shout out to all the teacher kids, spouses, parents, friends, and significant others who spend hours upon hours helping the teachers they love create spaces kids will love. ❤️ It’s true that we probably should have added something about “in the classroom and out” into our marriage vows. 🤗😂 #teacher #iteach #teachers #backtoschool #classroomsetup #classroomorganization #iteachtoo

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mary Montero ✏️ TWAMV on August 20, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text.

node.text: The Day You Begin is one of the best children’s books I’ve ever read. After we read it at the beginning of the year, the kids write down (anonymously) things that make them unique. Then we go through and read the sticky notes out loud. If there are kids who had something in common, we place a heart next to the sticky note. I saw some sweet little eyes light up when they realized they had more in common with others than they thought! This would be a perfect morning meeting activity.

node.text: Drop the name of your FAVORITE BTS read aloud below! 👇 I compiled my essential collection of back to school books for the upper grades. node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mary Montero ✏️ TWAMV on August 18, 2021. May be an image of text.

node.text: Let's talk transitions! ⌛ This is one of my favorite strategies for motivating students to get their transitions down! After they know the expectations for transitioning, I have a student timekeeper time how long each transition takes...they LOVE trying to beat their time and I love saving all those precious minutes for instruction!

node.text: Who is going back to school with students this week?! 🙋🏼‍♀️ 🤗 My Getting To Know You Task Cards are my MOST popular back to school resource, and there are so many ways to use them. 🤗 Play SCOOT for the original version, use the digital version if you’re remote or just want a fun back to school project, or put up each as a slide and have students go to town discussing or writing their answers! Link in profile to download the MAJOR updates. #teach #backtoschool #teachersofinstagram #firstdayofschool #school #iteach http://bit.ly/BackToSchoolTaskCards

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mary Montero ✏️ TWAMV on August 13, 2021.

node.text: Do you require your students to restate the question in their written answers? I don’t ALL the time, but I do make sure they know how to do it and why it’s important. This free activity is always a fun one that results in many lightbulb moments! 💡 Link in profile to download it now. http://bit.ly/RestatingTheQuestion

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mary Montero ✏️ TWAMV on August 11, 2021. May be an illustration.

node.text: If ever there were a year to implement weekly (or biweekly or monthly) letter writing, this is the one. I started this tradition my first year teaching after watching my cooperating teacher faithfully do it every week while I student taught. It is so, so meaningful to students, and I have learned an incredible amount about my students by reading their letters! Link in profile to details and free information. #backtoschool #classroom #classroomtraditions #classcommunity #buildingcommunity #teach http://bit.ly/WeeklyLetterWritingHomework
